title: Ferrariguy296
author: Ferrariguy296
content: Hi, Anyone knows how can i sell my car for crypto like what is the process? Im in Monaco spain and france area

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: Ferrariguy296 on November 11, 2022, 10:34:53 PMHi, Anyone knows how can i sell my car for crypto like what is the process? Im in Monaco spain and france area  I would assume that the process is no different than if you were selling it for cash. You might have to declare any change in the value of the crypto from the time it’s received until the time you sell it for tax purposes, but there’s nothing special you have to do outside of that. The most difficult part would be finding someone willing to spend their crypto on a vehicle, but once that’s lined up it should be as simple as making the transfer and dining the papers.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: Ferrariguy296 on November 11, 2022, 10:34:53 PMHi, Anyone knows how can i sell my car for crypto like what is the process? Im in Monaco spain and france area  Easier way would be to first exchange Bitcoin for cash using p2p exchange and than just buy car with cash.Problem is that some countries have limitations for cash purchases, and you would need to check law for that in Monaco, Spain and France.You could also try making one ad asking to buy a used car and add Bitcoin as one of accepted payment method, among others.I saw Bitpay is offering a way to buy cars with Bitcoin, so you could research this option more.ImportMarques is one of the websites in Europe that accept Bitcoin with Bitpay.https://bitpay.com/blog/how-to-buy-a-car-with-bitcoin/There is one more website but it only operates in UK and Ireland:https://www.autocoincars.com/

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Most of the used cars in my area are advertised on Craig's List, which has a "cyrpto ok" setting that sellers can select.  I've sold cars and some other stuff using Craig's List and always enable that option, but no one has ever paid me in Bitcoin.  If you insist on being paid in Bitcoin you're going to limit your market and turn away many potential buyers.  If you goal is to turn the car's value into Bitcoin, you might be better indicating in your ad that you'll accept either cash or Bitcoin.  If you get paid in cash, you can use a P2P exchange to convert it into Bitcoin.

comments.author: Termin4tor
comments.body: If you would like to sell your car for crypto in the Monaco, Spain and France area, you'll need to find a crypto-accepting car dealership. You can search online to find a dealership in the area that accepts crypto. You may also want to look for peer-to-peer marketplaces, where you can post an ad to sell the vehicle and may be able to find a buyer who is willing to pay with crypto. Once you find a buyer, you can agree on a price and method of payment (e.g. which type of cryptocurrency, digital wallet, etc). Then you can complete the transaction, and the buyer can take possession of the car.

Im in Monaco spain and france area  It is good you want to sell your car for Crypto as a means of payment. If I may ask why do you want to sell off your car by accepting Crypto as a means of payment? Are you trying to evade tax payment just like a member said here or what? Well if you deem it right to sell your car for Crypto, that is my an issue it would also create a good business link for you though. This is also one of the functions of bitcoin no much stress or third party involved and less transaction fees to pay with a swift transfer.  In this case, if you are trying to make your deal confidential peer to peer would be much better to get involved with so as not to create awareness of your transaction. You would only need to change ownership which would not be an issue if any inquiry comes up about the ownership of the car.
